Class RhombDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • RhombDisplay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class RhombDisplay
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    A class for drawing and modifying a patch of rhombs. The modifications happen when the user clicks on a trio of rhombs, which are an instance of a Hex. The rhombs in this Hex are then rotated, which changes the Hexes in this that can subsequently be modified.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RhombDisplay

        public RhombDisplay(RhombBoundary r)
             throws java.awt.HeadlessException
        Default Constructor. Use the default SCALE and infer the window size from the contents of r, with WIDTH_BUFFER and HEIGHT_BUFFER added to the edges.
        Parameters:
        r - The underlying patch that this allows the user to edit.
        Throws:
        java.awt.HeadlessException

        Parameters:

        h - The height of this component.

      • click

        public void click(java.util.List<Hex> l)
        Call this method whenever a Hex is clicked on.
        Parameters:

      • flushButtons

        public void flushButtons(java.util.List<Hex> l)
        Refresh the list of buttons that can be clicked in this.
        Parameters:
        l - A List of Hexes to add and remove. For each element of l, if this already has a corresponding button, then we remove it, otherwise we create such a button and add it.

      • resetButtons

        public void resetButtons()
        Clear all the buttons and create new ones from the RhombBoundary in this.

      • setEditor

        public static void setEditor(SubstitutionEditor e)
        Set the SubstitutionEditor to which all RhombDisplays point. When a RhombDisplay is changed, this change will be reflected in the PatchDisplay of e.
        Parameters:
        e - All RhombDisplays will now point to e.

      • displayList

        public static java.util.List<RhombDisplay> displayList(java.util.List<RhombBoundary> rules,
                                       int paneWidth,
                                       int paneHeight)
        Take a List of RhombBoundaries and return a List of the corresponding RhombDisplays, all given the same scale, which is chosen in such a way as to make each one fit in a pane of the given dimensions.
        Parameters:
        rules - The RhombBoundaries we want to put into RhombDisplays.
        paneWidth - The width of the pane in which we want each one to fit.
        paneHeight - The height of the pane in which we want each one to fit.
        Returns:
        A List of RhombDisplays generated from rules, each one scaled to fit in a pane of dimensions paneWidth x paneHeight.
